Name: Fair Housing Act
Summary: Prohibits discrimination in housing on the basis of disability, among other protected characteristics.
Application: Requires landlords to make reasonable accommodations for tenants with disabilities and allow reasonable modifications to the premises.

Name: Architectural Barriers Act
Summary: Requires that buildings and facilities designed, constructed, altered, or leased with federal funds be accessible to individuals with disabilities.
Application: Applies to federal buildings, including post offices, social security offices, federal courthouses, and prisons. Ensures physical accessibility in federally funded buildings.

Name: Architectural Barriers Act (ABA)
Summary: Requires buildings and facilities designed, built, or altered with federal funds to be accessible.
Application: Applies to all buildings receiving federal funding.

Name: Section 501 of the Rehabilitation Act
Summary: Prohibits federal employers from discriminating against qualified individuals with disabilities. Sets employment goals for people with disabilities.
Application: Federal agencies must adopt the goal of having 12% of their workforce be people with disabilities and 2% be people with targeted disabilities. Applies to hiring, promotion, and retention practices.

Name: Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act
Summary: Prohibits employment discrimination based on disability by federal contractors or subcontractors.
Application: Applies to companies doing business with the federal government. Requires contractors to take affirmative action to recruit, hire, promote, and retain individuals with disabilities.

Name: Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act
Summary: Prohibits discrimination and requires reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in federal agencies, programs, or activities.
Application: Applies to all organizations receiving federal funding. Requires provision of reasonable accommodations to employees and program participants with disabilities.

Name: Rehabilitation Act - Section 503
Summary: Prohibits federal contractors and subcontractors from discriminating in employment against individuals with disabilities and requires affirmative action.
Application: Applies to companies that do business with the federal government.

Name: Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA)
Summary: Ensures students with disabilities are provided with Free Appropriate Public Education (FAPE) tailored to their individual needs.
Application: Applies to public schools. Requires the development of Individualized Education Programs (IEPs) for students with disabilities and the provision of necessary accommodations and services.

Name: Air Carrier Access Act
Summary: Prohibits discrimination on the basis of disability in air travel.
Application: Requires airlines to provide accommodations, accessible facilities, and services to passengers with disabilities. Applies to all flights to, from, or within the United States.

Name: Hearing Aid Compatibility Act
Summary: Requires certain telephones to be compatible with hearing aids.
Application: Applies to manufacturers and service providers of telephones and mobile devices. Ensures a range of hearing aid compatible phones are available.

Name: Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)
Summary: Comprehensive civil rights law prohibiting discrimination against individuals with disabilities in all areas of public life.
Application: Applies to employers, state and local governments, public accommodations, commercial facilities, transportation, and telecommunications. Requires reasonable accommodations and accessibility in various contexts.

Name: ADA Title I
Summary: Prohibits employment discrimination against qualified individuals with disabilities.
Application: Applies to employers with 15 or more employees. Requires reasonable accommodations in the workplace.

Name: ADA Title II
Summary: Prohibits disability discrimination by all public entities at the local and state level.
Application: Requires public entities to make their programs, services, and activities accessible to individuals with disabilities.

Name: ADA Title III
Summary: Prohibits disability discrimination by places of public accommodation.
Application: Requires businesses and nonprofit service providers to provide accessible goods and services.

Name: Television Decoder Circuitry Act
Summary: Requires televisions 13 inches or larger to have built-in decoder circuitry to display closed captions.
Application: Manufacturers must ensure TVs can display closed captions. Has been updated to include digital television receivers.

Name: Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) - Title I
Summary: Prohibits discrimination against individuals with disabilities in all aspects of employment, including hiring, pay, promotion, and firing.
Application: Applies to employers with 15 or more employees, including state and local governments.

Name: Section 255 of the Communications Act
Summary: Requires telecommunications products and services be accessible to people with disabilities.
Application: Applies to manufacturers of telecommunications equipment and providers of telecommunications services. They must ensure products and services are accessible and usable by individuals with disabilities.

Name: Telecommunications Act Section 706
Summary: Requires the FCC to encourage the deployment of advanced telecommunications capability to all Americans, including those with disabilities.
Application: Promotes the development of broadband infrastructure and services that are accessible to individuals with disabilities.

Name: Telecommunications Act of 1996 - Section 255
Summary: Requires telecommunications products and services to be accessible to people with disabilities.
Application: Applies to manufacturers and service providers in the telecommunications industry.

Name: Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act
Summary: Requires federal agencies to make their electronic and information technology accessible to people with disabilities.
Application: Applies to all federal agencies when they develop, procure, maintain, or use electronic and information technology. Agencies must provide disabled employees and public members access to information comparable to others.

Name: Assistive Technology Act
Summary: Establishes grant program to support state programs addressing assistive technology needs of individuals with disabilities.
Application: Provides funding to states to develop programs that increase access to and acquisition of assistive technology for individuals with disabilities of all ages.

Name: Ticket to Work and Work Incentives Improvement Act
Summary: Provides work incentives and employment services for individuals with disabilities receiving Social Security benefits.
Application: Applies to individuals receiving Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) and Supplemental Security Income (SSI).

Name: Executive Order 13163
Summary: Promotes increased employment opportunities in the federal government for individuals with disabilities.
Application: Directs federal agencies to increase employment of people with disabilities through enhanced recruitment efforts.

Name: Executive Order 13164
Summary: Requires federal agencies to establish written procedures for processing reasonable accommodation requests.
Application: Federal agencies must develop and implement procedures to facilitate the provision of reasonable accommodations.

Name: Help America Vote Act
Summary: Mandates improvements to voting systems and voter access for the nation's voting process.
Application: Requires polling places to be physically accessible and voting systems to be accessible for individuals with disabilities, including nonvisual accessibility for the blind and visually impaired.

Name: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) Regulations on Disability Discrimination
Summary: Enforces ADA provisions related to employment discrimination and ensures reasonable accommodations are provided.
Application: Applies to all employers covered by the ADA.

Name: Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act (MHPAEA)
Summary: Requires that health insurance plans provide the same level of benefits for mental health and substance use disorders as they do for physical health conditions.
Application: Applies to employer-sponsored health plans, Medicaid managed care, and individual health plans.

Name: 21st Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act
Summary: Requires advanced communications services and products be accessible to people with disabilities.
Application: Applies to providers of advanced communications services and manufacturers of equipment used for these services. Requires accessibility features in smartphones, television programming, and streaming services.

Name: Executive Order 13548
Summary: Aims to increase federal employment of individuals with disabilities.
Application: Directs federal agencies to improve their efforts to employ workers with disabilities through increased recruitment, hiring, and retention.

Name: Affordable Care Act (ACA) - Section 1557
Summary: Prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in health programs and activities receiving federal financial assistance.
Code: blv, dhh, mobility, cognitive, mental health
Application: Applies to all health programs and activities receiving federal funding.

Name: Federal Plain Language Guidelines
Summary: Provides guidance on clear communication in government writing.
Application: While not specific to disabilities, these guidelines help make government communications more accessible to all, including those with cognitive disabilities.

Name: Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act
Summary: Aims to increase access to employment, education, training, and support services for individuals with barriers to employment, including those with disabilities.
Application: Provides funding for job training programs and requires state and local workforce development systems to be accessible to individuals with disabilities.

Name: Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA)
Summary: Helps job seekers with disabilities access employment, education, training, and support services to succeed in the labor market.
Application: Applies to workforce development programs and initiatives.

Name: OMB Circular A-130
Summary: Establishes general policy for federal agencies' management of information resources.
Application: Requires agencies to implement accessibility standards in their information management practices.

Name: Section 508 Refresh
Summary: Updates to the Section 508 standards to align with modern technology and international standards.
Application: Federal agencies must comply with these updated standards when procuring, developing, or maintaining ICT.

Name: 21st Century IDEA (Integrated Digital Experience Act)
Summary: Requires executive branch agencies to modernize websites, digitize services and forms, and improve customer services.
Application: Federal agencies must ensure their websites are accessible, consistent, and secure. Requires digitization of government services and forms to improve public access.

Name: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
Summary: Provides recommendations for making Web content more accessible.
Application: While not a law, these guidelines are often cited in legal cases and used as a standard for web accessibility.

Name: Executive Order on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Accessibility in the Federal Workforce
Summary: Aims to strengthen the federal workforce by promoting diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility.
Application: Federal agencies must assess their DEIA efforts, develop strategic plans to eliminate barriers to equity, and enhance accessibility in the federal workplace.

Name: OMB M-23-22 - Delivering a Digital-First Public Experience
Summary: Guidance on improving digital services and experiences for the public.
Application: Federal agencies must prioritize digital service delivery, modernize websites and digital services, and ensure accessibility and usability for all users.

Name: OMB M-24-08 - Strengthening Digital Accessibility and the Management of Section 508
Summary: Provides guidance on improving digital accessibility and Section 508 compliance.
Application: Agencies must designate a Section 508 Program Manager, conduct regular accessibility testing, and integrate accessibility requirements into IT governance processes.

Name: Mental Health America (MHA)
Summary: A leading community-based nonprofit dedicated to addressing the needs of those living with mental illness and promoting overall mental health.
Application: Focuses on prevention, early identification, and intervention for mental health issues.

Name: ADA National Network
Summary: Provides information, guidance and training on the ADA.
Application: Offers resources and training to individuals with disabilities, businesses, and state/local governments on understanding and implementing the ADA.

Name: Job Accommodation Network (JAN)
Summary: Provides free, expert, and confidential guidance on job accommodations and disability employment issues.
Application: Assists both employees and employers in understanding and implementing effective accommodations in the workplace.

Name: Accessible Technology Coalition
Summary: Provides resources and information on accessible technology for people with disabilities.
Application: Offers guidance on choosing and using assistive technologies, as well as making mainstream technologies more accessible.

Name: Center for Accessible Technology
Summary: Promotes the use of technology by children and adults with disabilities.
Application: Provides information, referrals, and hands-on support to help people with disabilities effectively use technology.

Name: Center for Accessible Technology
Summary: Promotes the use of technology by children and adults with disabilities.
Application: Provides information, referrals, and hands-on support to help people with disabilities effectively use technology.

Name: National Deaf Center on Postsecondary Outcomes
Summary: Provides resources and support for deaf individuals in postsecondary settings.
Application: Offers guidance, research, and training to improve postsecondary outcomes for deaf individuals.

Name: National Association of the Deaf
Summary: Advocates for the rights and quality of life of deaf and hard of hearing individuals in the United States.
Application: Provides resources, advocacy, and information on legal rights for the deaf and hard of hearing community.

Name: American Foundation for the Blind
Summary: Provides resources and advocacy for individuals who are blind or visually impaired.
Application: Offers information on assistive technologies, employment resources, and advocacy initiatives for the blind and visually impaired.

Name: National Federation of the Blind
Summary: Largest organization of blind and low-vision people in the United States.
Application: Provides advocacy, education, research, technology, and programs encouraging independence of the blind.

Name: United Spinal Association
Summary: Dedicated to enhancing the quality of life of people with spinal cord injuries and disorders.
Application: Provides resources, advocacy, and support for individuals with spinal cord injuries and disorders.

Name: Autistic Self Advocacy Network
Summary: Seeks to advance the principles of the disability rights movement with regard to autism.
Application: Provides resources and advocacy for autistic individuals, promoting self-advocacy and neurodiversity.

Name: Learning Disabilities Association of America
Summary: Provides support and resources for individuals with learning disabilities.
Application: Offers information, advocacy, and support for individuals with learning disabilities and their families.

Name: National Center on Disability and Access to Education
Summary: Provides resources and guidance on accessibility and disability-related issues in education.
Application: Offers training, resources, and advocacy for educational institutions to improve access for students with disabilities.

Name: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA)
Summary: An agency within the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services that leads public health efforts to advance the behavioral health of the nation.
Application: Provides resources, programs, and information on mental health and substance abuse.

Name: National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI)
Summary: The largest grassroots mental health organization in the U.S. dedicated to building better lives for millions of Americans affected by mental illness.
Application: Provides support, education, and advocacy for people with mental health conditions.

Name: Disability Employment Policy Resources
Summary: Department of Labor's Office of Disability Employment Policy (ODEP) provides various resources and initiatives.
Application: Offers guidance, best practices, and resources to promote the employment of people with disabilities in both the public and private sectors.

Name: U.S. Access Board Guidelines and Standards
Summary: Develops and maintains accessibility guidelines and standards for the built environment, transportation, and ICT.
Application: These guidelines form the basis for enforceable standards under various laws like the ADA and Section 508.

Name: National Council on Disability (NCD) Policy Recommendations
Summary: Independent federal agency that provides advice to the President, Congress, and federal agencies on disability policy.
Application: NCD's recommendations often influence federal disability policies and legislation.

Name: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) Guidance
Summary: Provides interpretations and guidance on how various laws apply to disability discrimination in employment.
Application: Helps employers and employees understand their rights and responsibilities under disability employment laws.

Name: Federal Communications Commission (FCC) Accessibility Regulations
Summary: Implements and enforces accessibility-related provisions of communications laws.
Application: Covers areas such as telecommunications relay services, closed captioning, audio description, and accessible emergency information.
